Not sure if this has been suggested before, but from what I've seen in videos, the ejection seat likes to tumble a lot when ejecting.

I can this going wrong for people, where the seat tumbles right back into the craft.

Maybe it's a possibility to add an ASAS module to the seat? So that the seat goes straight out, and has no chance to create spectacular mishaps.

Edited August 26, 2012 by Melfice

Not sure if this has been suggested before, but from what I've seen in videos, the ejection seat likes to tumble a lot when ejecting.

I can this going wrong for people, where the seat tumbles right back into the craft.

Maybe it's a possibility to add an ASAS module to the seat? So that the seat goes straight out, and has no chance to create spectacular mishaps.

ASAS module would be nice but you would have to turn it on manually before ejecting. Also you would need to add an extra part to the seat, making it more complicated to construct. I could add "rotation damping" to the seat but that would interfere with flight characteristics of the entire craft.

The best option in my opinion would be to balance the seat by combining the two miniboosters to 1 part and then adjust the thrustCenter and thrustVector values in config file. I get there eventually, but its low priority at the moment since the seat appears to be working and there is changes around the corner for the seat (the tedious proces of staring at kerbal models in the game and replicating them vertex by vertex and then attaching it to the seat).

Now that you're still working on the landing gear, could you add a double wheeled gear as well please?

The plan at the moment is to have light, medium and heavy landing gears combinations. Each combination has front and back landing gears. The heavy version has at least two wheels.

That is really G R E A T news!!!

Testing the EES (easy editable skins), these two different skins are result of just slapping a colour + tileable camo pattern and for the other slapping two colours and drawing a staight line. Now it doesn't give you too much control but you can change colours of you favourite plane. Only grief is that the texture has to be converted using part tools at the moment. EES will be available in the next update.
